= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Eye sensory data* (*eye-sensory*)
   * Eye - rods and cones (eye-edge-output -> [BrainRegionVBA_FD_RT VBA.FD.RT]): after on-center/off-center edge extraction and zipping 100:1
   * Eye - somatic receptors (eye-somatic -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG AVA.PN.SG.TRG]): eye -> semilunar ganglion/ophthalmic -> PTR
   * Eye - visceral receptors (eye-visceral -> [BrainRegionHMA_MM_MSTR HMA.MM.MSTR]): eye -> semilunar ganglion/ophthalmic -> STR, proprioception
  * *Eye rotation motor muscles* (*eye-rotation-motor*)
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inferior_oblique_muscle Eye - inferior oblique muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN VBA.MM.OCN] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-major-inferior-oblique]): extorsion, elevation, abduction
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inferior_rectus_muscle Eye - inferior rectus muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN VBA.MM.OCN] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-major-inferior-rectus]): depression and adduction
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medial_rectus_muscle Eye - medial rectus muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN VBA.MM.OCN] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-major-medial-rectus]): adducts the eyeball
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superior_rectus_muscle Eye - superior rectus muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN VBA.MM.OCN] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-major-superior-rectus]): elevates, adducts, and rotates medially the eye
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levator_palpebrae_superioris_muscle Eye - levator palpebrae superioris muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN VBA.MM.OCN] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-major-levator-palpebrae]): retracts/elevates eyelid
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superior_oblique_muscle Eye - superior oblique muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_MM_TRH VBA.MM.TRH] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-minor]): superior oblique, rotation in a vertical plane - looking down and up, rotation in the plane of the face
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lateral_rectus_muscle Eye - lateral rectus muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_HP_ABD VBA.HP.ABD] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-rotate-vestibular]): lateral rectus, quick turn to the right -> compensatory reflex turning of two eyes to the left
  * *Eye pupil and accomodation motor muscles* (*eye-pupil-motor*)
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ciliary_muscle Eye - ciliary muscle - sympathetic] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG AVA.PN.SYM.SCG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-curvature-sympathetic]): to ciliary muscle to increase eye accomodation
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ciliary_muscle Eye - ciliary muscle - parasympathetic] ([BrainRegionVBA_PN_PSYM_CLG VBA.PN.PSYM.CLG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-curvature-parasympathetic]): to ciliary muscle to inhibit eye accomodation
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iris_sphincter_muscle Eye - iris sphincter muscle] ([BrainRegionVBA_PN_PSYM_EPG VBA.PN.PSYM.EPG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-pupil-close]): to sphincter pupillae to close pupil
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iris_dilator_muscle Eye - iris dilator muscle] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG AVA.PN.SYM.SCG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-pupil-open]): to dilator pupillae to open pupil
  * *Eyelid motor muscles* (*eyelid-motor*)
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbicularis_oculi_muscle Eye - orbicularis oculi muscle:temporal] ([BrainRegionHMA_HP_FCM HMA.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-close-conscious-orbital]): orbital portion, contraction of the orbital to reduce glare
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbicularis_oculi_muscle Eye - orbicularis oculi muscle:zygomatic] ([BrainRegionHMA_HP_FCM HMA.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-close-conscious-lacrimal]): lacrimal part (tensor tarsi), conscious muscle to close eye; draws the eyelids and the ends of the lacrimal canals medialward and compresses them against the surface of the globe of the eye; compresses the lacrimal sac
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbicularis_oculi_muscle Eye - orbicularis oculi muscle:palpebrale] ([BrainRegionHMA_HP_FCM HMA.HP.FCM] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-close-involuntary-palpebrale]): palpebral portion, acts involuntarily, closing the lids gently; involuntary muscle to close eye
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superior_tarsal_muscle Eye - superior tarsal muscle] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG AVA.PN.SYM.SCG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-superior-tarsal]): raise the upper eyelid
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarsus_%28eyelids%29 Eye - inferior tarsal muscle] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG AVA.PN.SYM.SCG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-muscle-inferior-tarsal]): lower lid retraction
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbitalis_muscle Eye - orbitalis muscle] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_SYM_SCG AVA.PN.SYM.SCG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-orbitalis-muscle]): protrusion of eyeball
  * *Eye glands* (*eye-glands*)
   * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lacrimal_gland Eye - lacrimal gland] ([BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_SPG AVA.PN.PSYM.SPG] -> [HumanMusclesHead eye-tears-gland]): tears
   * Eye - lacrimal gland and conjunctiva receptors (eye-lacrimal-gland-conjunctiva-receptors -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG AVA.PN.SG.TRG]): tears
